text: 380px Madonna and Child with the Infant St John the Baptist and Saint Barbara is a 1548 oil on panel painting by Daniele Ricciarelli da Volterra, now in the Uffizi.Paul Barolsky, Daniele Da Volterra: A Catalogue Raisonné, Garland Publishing, 1979. ==History== According to Benedetto Falconcini's Elogio this work and Elijah in the Desert were still in the artist's descendants' house in Volterra in 1772, before descending to the Pannocchieschi counts of Elci. Roberto Paolo Ciardi and Benedetta Moreschini, Daniele Ricciarelli. Da Volterra a Roma, Volterra, Cassa di risparmio di Volterra, 2004. An export bar was placed on the work in 1979 and it remained the last work by the artist in private hands until the Uffizi acquired it in September 2019. ==References== category:Paintings of the Madonna and Child category:Paintings of the Uffizi category:Paintings by Daniele da Volterra category:Paintings depicting John the Baptist category:Paintings of Saint Barbara
title: Madonna and Child with the Infant St John the Baptist and Saint Barbara
